snippet: TAMBER--Jerry, 95, died Sunday, November 1, 2015 in New Bern, North Carolina. Jerry was born in Brooklyn, NY on September 25, 1920. He lived there until he and his wife, Nina, moved to Freeport, NY. They lived there for 40 years and raised their daughters. He spent many years in New York's garment district in different capacities, from gopher to buyer, merchandise manager, manufacturer, and shop owner. In his later years he went back to school and became a broker and Certified Financial Planner. When Jerry retired, he and his wife moved to Boynton Beach, FL where they lived for 10 years. Health reasons prompted them to move to the New Bern area of North Carolina, and then to the Homeplace of New Bern, his final residence. Jerry is survived by his wife of 73 years, Nina R. Tamber, his daughters, Abbie Tamber of Oxford, NY and Mattie Czyzyk and her husband Richard of Beaufort, NC. He will always be remembered for the jokes he told. 1/3
lead_paragraph: TAMBER--Jerry, 95, died Sunday, November 1, 2015 in New Bern, North Carolina. Jerry was born in Brooklyn, NY on September 25, 1920. He lived there until he and his wife, Nina, moved to Freeport, NY. They lived there for 40 years and raised their daughters. He spent many years in New York's garment district in different capacities, from gopher to buyer, merchandise manager, manufacturer, and shop owner. In his later years he went back to school and became a broker and Certified Financial Planner. When Jerry retired, he and his wife moved to Boynton Beach, FL where they lived for 10 years. Health reasons prompted them to move to the New Bern area of North Carolina, and then to the Homeplace of New Bern, his final residence. Jerry is survived by his wife of 73 years, Nina R. Tamber, his daughters, Abbie Tamber of Oxford, NY and Mattie Czyzyk and her husband Richard of Beaufort, NC. He will always be remembered for the jokes he told. 1/3
